intro: Medinilla vagans, commonly known as the velvet tangerine, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are known for their long-lasting bloom and are popular in horticulture for ornamental purposes. Medinilla vagans thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
